text: Thanks <@U7SL518D6>!
just a general Q: anyone feel like recommending a client upgrade to DM2 is like pulling teeth?
follow up Q: anyone know a dentist that can confirm that pulling teeth is actually hard?
I think it's generally easy for the dentist, but hard for the client
Not sure what your services process looks like, but we haven't had to tell any of our clients to upgrade... we just do it lol. Haven't had any issues thus far

lol, I think it’s harder for us because we work for agencies, who work for the end-client.

So we feel we have to get the agency to okay it first.
ah. yeah. That doesn't sound fun...
So when you go to users under settings and choose reset password, is anything suppose to happen, cause all it did was close the users pane

Nice, forms on all of our client sites just broke. this is about a week after the var:flex bug has wiped us out, having to manually re-create content across virtually every site we’ve built in the last 2 years.
Lean Labs needs to be on some sort of roadmap for what changes are coming b/c we’re going to lose clients if sites are randomly breaking.

Currently any modules using the tag from <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags#form> are breaking across  all of our client sites. They're pulling the default form and can't be updated via the editor *Example here - <https://info.trybaker.com/seedemo> *
<@U26B530N6> <@U22PU4G4A> not sure who is right to ask for support, the pain for this issue is rather severe. We’re no able to fix it in the page editor.
<@U6GNQ7JBU> <@U22PJPGK0> <@U22PU4G4A> pinging you because this seems like a big issue
:eyes:
Should be fixed < 2 minutes
<@U2TE487LZ>
Those forms are up and running again.
Not for me yet
Taking a look
Which portal?
nice.  <@U6GNQ7JBU> can i get a little undertanding b/c I have some ’splainin to to do to clients, some of which are not yet yet fully cooled off from the var:flex issue we recently had.
In this example, it looks like the correct form is being loaded from what I can tell
Currently looking at why this happened and why it wasn't caught in the deploy process
nvm looking good now, thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU>!
scratch that, late to the party and saw this has been fixed

Essentially there was a bug with forms using the name of their parent container as their name/unique id when they weren't given a name/id themselves, so two or more forms that shared the same container would only render 1 of the forms. There was a fix to stop the forms from using their parents name as their name, however these seemed to have broken page level overrides for forms and wasn't caught in our pre-deploy checking
<@U6GNQ7JBU> thanks. appreciate the fast action.
for the GDPR Banner / Cookie Consent, is there a separate place for the CSS so you can change the looks or do we just do our own thing in the CSS files for the site

We're working on a CMS Changelog to document minor/major updates and betas. This will help with communication on changes and potential issues. Planning for launch in the next 2-3 months (some internal logistics to figure out) AND i'm sure it won't be perfect to start... but it's a step in the right direction for better communication between product and cms developers.
cc. <@U2SJA29B4> <@U2TE487LZ>
Thanks <@U22PKFRU5>
In the new academy is there a way to quickly filter to just the "certifications" items and not all the other tracks?
Also, is there no longer a COS Design Cert or is this being redone?
just noticed that it was missing in the list of ones under the "My Team" listing
nice. thanks <@U22PKFRU5>
I’ve heard it’s being re-done to have content about the new design manager.
thought so

I don't believe so right now - All academy content use to be hosted on CMS pages... but we now have a product team building our own LMS. The LMS is pretty new and still lots to work on ... one of those things is filtering. I will pass this on to the team working on it.

The game plan is to retire the Design Certification and replace it with two new certs:
> CMS for Developers (code-focused)
> CMS for Marketers (visual editor/GDD focused) 

I don't have timelines on any of this tho. What I do know is that new content is being created now and it will likely be released in batches over the next 3-6 months.

We will also be launching a "CMS Developer Discovery Kit" ... which will work as a quick, light weight way for developers to get setup and understand the CMS. 

This will be an amazing tool to use when onboarding new CMS developers onto your team. I'm shooting to have this sometime in September-ishhhhh
with the "CMS for Developers" acting as the deep dive into coding on CMS
Oooh interesting.
That's sort of weird, it should be displaying there... but maybe it was already retired... I'm not sure. Let me ask around
